rows.text: Roots and other life in the soil need both AIR and WATER to live, just like us.
Large pores or channels through the soil, allow the soil to drink in the rain, and also drain well so that plants donâ€™t become waterlogged and suffer.
The smallest pores store water for dry periods
Medium size pores or channels store both air and water.
ROOTS and MICROBES like fungi create these crumbs, and live in the pores or channels.
So to create this healthy arrangement of crumbs:
rows.subtext:
* Keep living roots in soils, and include perennial crops in crop rotations or at the margins of fields, see earlier slides
* Feed microbes in the soil by returning organic matter to soils, see the earlier slides.
